thread.title: Top Canadian national parks to see fall foliage [Photos]
thread.title_full: Top Canadian national parks to see fall foliage [Photos]

title: Top Canadian national parks to see fall foliage [Photos]
text:
Top Canadian national parks to see fall foliage 
Postmedia Network Monday, September 28, 2015 08:00 AM EDT Top Canadian national parks to see fall foliage Previous Next 
Canada's national parks are some of the best places to see the blazing oranges, reds and yellows of changing fall foliage across the country. We team up with Parks Canada to list the top nine national parks across the country perfect for seeing gorgeous fall foliage on your autumn road trip. (Fotolia) 
Prince Edward Island National Park has a long fall season that includes some of the most vibrant colours in the country. See the best fall foliage through September and October. (Fotolia) 
New Brunswick's Fundy National Park features brilliant colours mixed with green coniferous trees, including some of the most varied colours in the country. See the bright reds and oranges of fall foliage in Fundy at their best in the first two weeks of October. (Fotolia) 
Nova Scotia's Cape Breton Highlands National Park includes a beautiful drive along the Cabot Trail with a full palette of colours. The colours in Cape Breton are at their most intense in the first two weeks of October. (Fotolia) 
Bruce Peninsula National Park in Ontario features incredible views of changing colours from the hiking trails. The fall colours in Bruce Peninsula are at their brightest from the end of September to early October. (Fotolia) 
Quebec's Forillon National Park is home to beautiful maple trees. Fall colours in Quebec are at their brightest in late September through mid-to-late October. (Courtesy Parks Canada/N. Boisvert) 
Prince Albert National Park in Saskatchewan includes hills with aspen parkland. See the colours at their brightest in September and October. (Parks Canada) 
Banff National Park in Alberta is home to larch trees, which display beautiful yellow needles for a brief period every fall. The best fall foliage colours in the Rockies can be seen in September and October. (Fotolia) 
Nova Scotia's Kejimkujik National Park features vibrant fall foliage. The fall foliage in Nova Scotia reaches its peak in mid October. (Courtesy Parks Canada/Eric LeBel) 
La Mauricie National Park in Quebec features a beautiful array of coloured leaves. The best time to see fall foliage in Quebec is between the end of September and the end of October. (Courtesy Parks Canada/J Pleau) Article
